column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Identify Emotional Disabilities
#Text=Parents and teachers alike often find themselves trying to identify emotional disabilities in children .
#Text=Early identification of any disorder helps a child to receive the help he or she needs .
#Text=Children display some actions that are very similar to others within a specific age range .
#Text=While comparison of children on a one-to-one basis is discouraged , a comparison within age groups presents a point of reference from which to work .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Track the emotional issues the child exhibits that concern you .
#Text=Think clearly about your concerns in contrast to any social problems the child has shown .
#Text=Ask yourself if the issues are recurrent enough to warrant this alarm .
#Text=Judge these issues against other developmental or behavioral disabilities that exist with the child .
#Text=Acknowledge any other challenges that are going on .
#Text=Many emotional issues are actually developmental or behavioral disabilities .
#Text=A child with one disability will frequently have more .
#Text=It is important to note the differences in issues .
#Text=The treatment differs in some instances .
#Text=Compare your concerns relating to one child ( quietly to yourself ) with those of others you know within the same age group .
#Text=You will then determine whether there is anything out of the norm .
#Text=Know the available health screenings that identify emotional disabilities .
#Text=These will include vision and hearing assessments as well as psychological testing to determine intellectual development .
#Text=Deficiencies and ratings of emotional skills are noted in testing .
#Text=Combine this with historical information of abilities , education and behavior evaluations .
#Text=Investigate these screenings and determine the issues they will prove and/or rule out .
#Text=Teachers who suspect a child has emotional disabilities must investigate possibilities thoroughly .
#Text=They will discuss their suspicions with the school counselor before approaching parents .
#Text=All those involved with the child must discuss the issues together if the child is within school age .
#Text=Schedule medical or psychological assessments necessary to help the child .
#Text=Parents should make the appropriate appointments and attend them with the child .
#Text=Medical evaluations will identify or rule out many health problems that are known to cause emotional problems .
#Text=Age appropriate psychological testing requires a long block of time .
#Text=Make certain the child understands this if you go this route .
#Text=Make it clear in your mind that the medical or psychological professional you visit has all of the information on which you have based your concerns .
#Text=Follow up with the professionals recommendations as appropriate .
#Text=Discuss educational needs the physician suggests .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=There are intellectual disorders that involve some very serious emotional disabilities .
#Text=Stay alert for this possibility .
#Text=Applied Behavior Analysis therapy is a controversial autism therapy that has led to tremendous success stories and stories of terror and trauma .
#Text=Be cautious , and recognize the difference between teaching skills and forcing compliance .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=A child who is marked by peers as emotionally disabled will have difficulties in school and experience serious life problems .
